The Elder Ambadāyaka’s Birth Story
“The Fortunate One Anomadassī,
sitting in the middle of a mountain;
with loving-kindness he pervaded the world,
immeasurable, without attachment.
I was a monkey at that time,
on the Himalayas, the best of mountains;
seeing that Anomadassī,
I had confidence in the Buddha.
Not far from the Himalayas,
in the mango trees there were ripe mangoes at that time;
then taking a ripe one,
I gave the mango with honey.
That was explained to me by the Buddha,

analyzed: anomadassī mahā muni  iminā madhu dānena
translated: the Great Seer Anomadassī;🔽by this gift of honey,
and the gift of the mango, both of them.
For fifty-seven aeons,
he will delight in the world of the gods;
in the remaining aeons,
he will go forth and wander.
Having cast off bad deeds,
with his mind matured,
having gone to the state of no-return,
he will burn up the defilements.
I was tamed by the best of tamers,
I was tamed by the Great Seer;
I have attained the unshakeable state,
having abandoned victory and defeat.
For seven hundred aeons,
and Ambattha, and Jasanā,
These fourteen kings,
universal monarchs of great power.
The four analytical knowledges,

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā ambadāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmai ambadāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: I have done the Teacher’s bidding.”🔽Thus the elder Ambadāyaka recited these verses.
The account of Ambadāyaka the Elder, the eighth.
